om.administration.questionbank
Class QuestionBankCleaningRequestHandler

java.lang.Object
  om.AbstractRequestHandler
      om.administration.questionbank.QuestionBankCleaningRequestHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, RequestHandler, GracefulFinalization
public class QuestionBankCleaningRequestHandler
extends AbstractRequestHandler

Provides http(s) request level access to a configured (or default) CleanQuestionBanks implementation to handle the request and respond back.

Author:
Trevor Hinson
See Also:

Constructor Detail

QuestionBankCleaningRequestHandler

public QuestionBankCleaningRequestHandler()
Method Detail

getCleanQuestionBanks

protected CleanQuestionBanks getCleanQuestionBanks(RequestAssociates associates)
                                            throws RequestHandlingException
Returns the composite cleanQuestionBanks implementation. The implementation itself can be configured. If there is no configuration then the default implementation is returned. NOTE - this implementation is based on a "per request" - is is not geared to be multi-threaded.

Parameters:
associates -
Returns:
Throws:
RequestHandlingException

retrieveConfiguredCleaner

protected CleanQuestionBanks retrieveConfiguredCleaner(java.lang.String className)
                                                throws RequestHandlingException
Tries to dynamically classload the className argument and IF this turns out to be a valid assignable class then it is returned. Otherwise the default implementation is returned.

Parameters:
className -
Returns:
Throws:
RequestHandlingException

pickUpClearanceResponse

protected ClearanceResponse pickUpClearanceResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
Tries to retrieve the ClearanceResponse from the users HttpSession. This should be available there IF there has already been a successful identification of superfluous questions.
